original_text:
Golden Knight II
Il bel cavaliere protagonista della slot Golden Knight, prodotta dalla software house High 5 Games torna sui rulli per una nuova puntata della saga, che mantiene la stessa tematica, ovviamente, ma aggiunge alcune caratteristiche in più soprattutto per quanto riguarda le impostazioni principali.
Il tema è anche qui quello Medioevale, lo sfondo della slot è rappresentato pure in questo caso da un paesaggio campestre al cui orizzonte si stagliano le cime di un enorme castello.
In genere, quando viene rilasciata la seconda versione di una slot già presente sul mercato, il provider si premura di apportare non solo delle novità a livello di funzionalità ma anche sul compartimento grafico: questo non è accaduto con Golden Knight 2, che come grafica è praticamente sovrapponibile alla versione precedente e allo stesso modo non risulta essere particolarmente convincente.
Non sono infatti presenti nemmeno qui delle animazioni tridimensionali o degli effetti speciali, in pieno stile High 5 Games, che ha mostrato una predilezione per le grafiche asciutte e lineari e propone nel suo catalogo quasi solo prodotti che non ci hanno entusiasmato da questo punto di vista.
Caratteristiche principali della slot machine
Abbiamo visto che il compartimento grafico non è stato migliorato, vediamo ora se è valsa la pena di rilasciare una nuova versione per quanto riguarda il gameplay e la presenza di funzionalità speciali.
La prima novità di Golden Knight 2 è il fatto che sia stata ottimizzata in modo tale da essere giocata non solo da computer desktop ma anche da tutti i dispositivi mobili, siano essi iOS o Android, in quanto essendo una slot con formato HTML5 il gioco resta fluido e definito, qualsiasi siano le dimensioni dello schermo.
La griglia è ancora quella tradizionale a cinque rulli, quattro righe e 40 linee di pagamento, sulle quali si possono effettuare delle scommesse a partire da 1 moneta fino a un massimo di 400, opzione quest’ultima che farà felice tutti gli high rollers.
Un altro miglioramento rispetto alla versione precedente è dato da un aumentato ritorno teorico al giocatore (return to player o RTP), che è passato dallo scadente 95% di Golden Knight a un decisamente migliore 96,5% di questa seconda puntata.
Infine, resta uguale la volatilità, che continua a essere media.
In conclusione, possiamo dire che, a parte qualche piccola variazione, il gameplay è praticamente identico, con le stesse funzioni e solo qualche possibilità in più di portare a casa delle vincite.
Slot machine simili alla saga di Golden Knight
Se vi piace il tema legato al Medioevo e amate vedere sui rulli spade, cavalli e cavalieri, allora vi consigliamo di dare un’occhiata per esempio anche alla slot Medieval Money, prodotta dalla software house IGT. Si tratta di una battaglia epica tra cavalieri che si muove su cinque rulli per 100 linee di pagamento e che offre la possibilità di portare a casa delle vincite che valgono fino a 1.000 volte il valore della puntata.

raw_translation.response:
Golden Knight II

The handsome knight protagonist of the Golden Knight slot, produced by High 5 Games, returns to the reels for a new installment of the saga that maintains the same theme, but adds some additional features, especially when it comes to main settings.

As expected, the theme is still Medieval, with the slot's background represented by a countryside landscape in which the peaks of a huge castle stand out on the horizon.

Usually, when the second version of a slot already on the market is released, the provider takes care to make improvements not only to the functionality level but also to the graphic compartment. However, this did not happen with Golden Knight 2, which, in terms of graphics, is practically identical to the previous version and is not particularly convincing.

Even here, there are no three-dimensional animations or special effects in full High 5 Games style. The provider has shown a preference for dry and linear graphics, with a catalog of products that have not excited the experienced gambler from this point of view.

Main features of the slot machine

We have seen that the graphic compartment has not been improved, but let's see if there is any merit in releasing a new version when it comes to gameplay and the presence of special features.

The first novelty of Golden Knight 2 is the fact that it has been optimized to be played not only from desktop computers but also from mobile devices, be they iOS or Android. As a slot with HTML5 format, the game remains fluid and defined, regardless of the screen size.

The grid is still the traditional one of five reels, four rows, and 40 pay lines. Bets can be made from 1 coin up to a maximum of 400, the latter option will make all high rollers happy.

Another improvement over the previous version is given by an increased theoretical return to the player (RTP), which has gone from the poor 95% of Golden Knight to a decidedly better 96.5% of this second episode. Finally, the volatility remains the same, with an average level.

In conclusion, we can say that, apart from some small variations, the gameplay is practically identical, with the same functions and only some extra chances to bring home winnings.

Slot machines similar to the Golden Knight saga

If you like the theme related to the Middle Ages and love to see swords, horses, and knights on the reels, then we recommend taking a look at the Medieval Money slot, produced by IGT software house. It is an epic battle between knights that moves on five reels and 100 pay lines, offering the chance to win up to 1,000 times the value of the bet.

message.content:
Golden Knight II

The handsome knight protagonist of the Golden Knight slot, produced by High 5 Games, returns to the reels for a new installment of the saga that maintains the same theme, but adds some additional features, especially when it comes to main settings.

As expected, the theme is still Medieval, with the slot's background represented by a countryside landscape in which the peaks of a huge castle stand out on the horizon.

Usually, when the second version of a slot already on the market is released, the provider takes care to make improvements not only to the functionality level but also to the graphic compartment. However, this did not happen with Golden Knight 2, which, in terms of graphics, is practically identical to the previous version and is not particularly convincing.

Even here, there are no three-dimensional animations or special effects in full High 5 Games style. The provider has shown a preference for dry and linear graphics, with a catalog of products that have not excited the experienced gambler from this point of view.

Main features of the slot machine

We have seen that the graphic compartment has not been improved, but let's see if there is any merit in releasing a new version when it comes to gameplay and the presence of special features.

The first novelty of Golden Knight 2 is the fact that it has been optimized to be played not only from desktop computers but also from mobile devices, be they iOS or Android. As a slot with HTML5 format, the game remains fluid and defined, regardless of the screen size.

The grid is still the traditional one of five reels, four rows, and 40 pay lines. Bets can be made from 1 coin up to a maximum of 400, the latter option will make all high rollers happy.

Another improvement over the previous version is given by an increased theoretical return to the player (RTP), which has gone from the poor 95% of Golden Knight to a decidedly better 96.5% of this second episode. Finally, the volatility remains the same, with an average level.

In conclusion, we can say that, apart from some small variations, the gameplay is practically identical, with the same functions and only some extra chances to bring home winnings.

Slot machines similar to the Golden Knight saga

If you like the theme related to the Middle Ages and love to see swords, horses, and knights on the reels, then we recommend taking a look at the Medieval Money slot, produced by IGT software house. It is an epic battle between knights that moves on five reels and 100 pay lines, offering the chance to win up to 1,000 times the value of the bet.

The background of the slot is also represented by a countryside landscape with the towering peaks of a huge castle in the horizon. There are no 3D animations nor special effects, in line with High5Games' preference for dry and linear graphics in their catalog that do not always excite players.

Main features of the slot machine

The first innovation of Golden Knight II is that it has been optimized to be played on both desktop computers and all mobile devices, whether iOS or Android, as HTML5 format allows for smooth and defined gameplay, regardless of screen size.

The grid remains the traditional five reels, four rows, and 40 paylines on which bets can be placed starting from 1 coin up to a maximum of 400, an option that will please all high rollers.

Another improvement over the previous version is an increased theoretical return to player (RTP), which has increased from the poor 95% of Golden Knight to the significantly better 96.5% of this second installment. Finally, volatility remains the same at a medium level.

response.headline: Gameplay and Features
response.content:
Golden Knight II is a game that takes everything that was great about the first installment of the series and adds some much-needed improvements. This time around, the game has been optimized for mobile devices, which means you can play it while you're on the go and never miss a beat. And let's be honest, who doesn't love being able to sneak in a bit of online gambling while they're supposed to be doing something else?

The game has five reels and four rows, which is pretty standard for a lot of slot games. But what sets Golden Knight II apart from the crowd is the fact that there are 40 pay lines. That means you've got a lot more chances to win than you would in a game with fewer pay lines. And if you're someone who likes to bet big, you're in luck - the maximum bet is a whopping 400 coins.

But the most important thing to know about Golden Knight II is that the theoretical return to player (RTP) has been increased to 96.5%. That means you've got a pretty good chance of winning some serious cash. Of course, we can't guarantee that you'll win, but we can guarantee that the odds are in your favor. And if you do win big, just make sure to send us a postcard from your new mansion in the south of France.

One thing that hasn't changed from the original Golden Knight game is the Medieval theme. But that's okay - everyone loves a good Medieval-themed slot game. There's just something about jousting, knights, and castles that really gets the blood pumping, you know? And with the average level of volatility, you can expect a fair number of wins and losses to keep things exciting.

Review: Golden Knight II

The handsome knight protagonist of the Golden Knight slot, produced by High 5 Games, returns to the reels for a new installment of the saga that maintains the same theme, but adds some additional features, especially when it comes to main settings.

As expected, the theme is still Medieval, with the slot's background represented by a countryside landscape in which the peaks of a huge castle stand out on the horizon.

Usually, when the second version of a slot already on the market is released, the provider takes care to make improvements not only to the functionality level but also to the graphic compartment. However, this did not happen with Golden Knight 2, which, in terms of graphics, is practically identical to the previous version and is not particularly convincing.

Even here, there are no three-dimensional animations or special effects in full High 5 Games style. The provider has shown a preference for dry and linear graphics, with a catalog of products that have not excited the experienced gambler from this point of view.

Main features of the slot machine

We have seen that the graphic compartment has not been improved, but let's see if there is any merit in releasing a new version when it comes to gameplay and the presence of special features.

The first novelty of Golden Knight 2 is the fact that it has been optimized to be played not only from desktop computers but also from mobile devices, be they iOS or Android. As a slot with HTML5 format, the game remains fluid and defined, regardless of the screen size.

The grid is still the traditional one of five reels, four rows, and 40 pay lines. Bets can be made from 1 coin up to a maximum of 400, the latter option will make all high rollers happy.

Another improvement over the previous version is given by an increased theoretical return to the player (RTP), which has gone from the poor 95% of Golden Knight to a decidedly better 96.5% of this second episode. Finally, the volatility remains the same, with an average level.

In conclusion, we can say that, apart from some small variations, the gameplay is practically identical, with the same functions and only some extra chances to bring home winnings.
